title: Ticket #4179: IPv4/IPv6 mixed-mode collector end-to-end test
description:
Miron requested a test showing that a mixed-mode IPv4/IPv6 collector can receive ads and respond to queries from condor_advertise and condor_status running on an IPv4 host, an IPv6 host, and a mixed-mode host.

The test has been run, and it works. A build from the master-ipv6-mixed-mode branch was used. A condor_collector was set up on a host supporting both protocols. Ads were successfully advertised using condor_advertise from the collector host (both IPv4 and IPv6), an IPv6-only host, an IPv4-only host, and a mixed mode host (using both IPv4 and IPv6). Ads were successfully retrieved using condor_status from the same set of hosts using the same protocols.

Conclusion: the condor_collector can successfully serve clients over IPv4 and IPv6.

The full report follow.

Commands are sorted by time. The command prompt shows which host each command was run on.

  • debian-00 has IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity. It is the collector in these tests
  • debian-01 only has IPv6 connectivity.
  • debian-02 only has IPv4 connectivity.
  • debian-03 has IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity.

Setup

For the sake of simplicity, the output from "./condor_install --make-personal-condor" has been omitted. 

debian-00$ tar xzf condor-8.1.3-219620-x86_64_Debian7-unstripped.tar.gz
debian-00$ cd condor-8.1.3-219620-x86_64_Debian7-unstripped/
debian-00$ ./condor_install --make-personal-condor
debian-00$ source condor.sh
debian-00$ ROOT=`pwd`
debian-00$ cat  >> etc/condor_config <<END
> # Turn on IPv6 support. (IPv4 support defaults to on.)
> ENABLE_IPV6 = TRUE
>
> # IPv6 still doesn't work with DNS. Turn it off.
> NO_DNS      = TRUE
> DEFAULT_DOMAIN_NAME=example.com
>
> # LOCAL_DIR defaults to using HOSTNAME, which doesn't work
> # with NO_DNS.
> LOCAL_DIR   = $ROOT/local
> LOCAL_CONFIG_FILE =
>
> # Simple security.
> ALLOW_WRITE_COLLECTOR = *
> ALLOW_READ_COLLECTOR = *
> END
debian-00$ mv local.`hostname` local
debian-00$ source condor.sh
debian-00$ condor_collector -f -p 9618

At this point this debian-00 session is busy running the collector. A new debian-00 session is started for further interactive testing

Submitting ads

debian-00$ CONDOR_CONFIG=condor_config.ipv4 condor_advertise  -pool 192-168-122-105.example.com UPDATE_STARTD_AD <<END
> _CONDOR_ENABLE_IPV6=FALSE condor_advertise  -pool 192-168-122-105.example.com UPDATE_STARTD_AD <<END
> MyType = "Machine"
> Machine = "1 test"
> Name = "IPv4 localhost"
> END
Sent 1 of 1 ad to 192-168-122-105.example.com.
debian-00$ CONDOR_CONFIG=condor_config.ipv6 condor_advertise  -pool fc00--5054-ff-fef9-a254.example.com UPDATE_STARTD_AD <<END

> Machine = "2 test"
> Name = "IPv6 localhost"
> END

Query ads

condor_status reports "(Omitted 6 malformed ads in computed attribute totals)". This is expected and harmless; the ads passed to condor_advertise were incomplete for the sake of brevity.

Each call should (and does) return 6 ads for:

  • IPv4 localhost
  • IPv6 localhost
  • IPv6 remote
  • IPv4 remote
  • IPv4(6) remote
  • IPv6(4) remote

If some of the ads had been missing, it would indicate that some of the calls to condor_advertise had not worked correctly. If any other error message was returned, it would indicate that calls to condor_status were not working correctly. All calls worked as expected.
